Class LineGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • spx.av.LineGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LineGraph
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener
    Class used to display scrolling line graphs.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setLineColour

        public void setLineColour(int lineIndex,
                          java.awt.Color colour)
        Set the colour for the specified line. All lines that have data get given a default colour. The first sixteen lines get different colours by default.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - Line index of line to set colour for.
        colour - Colour for line.

      • createColorFromIndex

        public static java.awt.Color createColorFromIndex(int lineIndex)
        Create a colour based on an index. 16 different colours are created by this function, in a cycle of red, yellow, green, blue, with 4 different shades of each.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - Index to calculate colour.
        Returns:
        Colour.
